neighbors.name: Estus, Carol
neighbors.claims: Carol Estus is a landowner in Mutual, a very small community (16 residents in 2023) [Data USA — other, retrieved 2025-12-17; "Mutual, OK had a population of 16 people with a median age of 40.8"](https://datausa.io/profile/geo/mutual-ok). She does not hold any public office; her name is absent from Woodward County’s list of officials [Woodward County Gov. — gov, retrieved 2025-12-17; "Wendy Dunlap County Clerk ... Kim Bowers County Treasurer"](https://woodward.okcounties.org/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally in an informal setting to build rapport and hear any concerns she might have.

neighbors.name: Scadden, Anna M. (Life Estate)
neighbors.claims: The parcel is held under a life estate for Anna M. Scadden, giving her use of the land for her lifetime and passing the remainder to heirs [OSU Extension — other, retrieved 2025-12-17; "...life estate in a farm... has the use of the farm during his or her lifetime"](https://extension.okstate.edu/fact-sheets/estate-planning-a-simplified-guide-for-oklahoma-farm-and-ranch-families.html). No evidence was found of Scadden taking any public stance or community leadership role [Woodward County Gov. — gov, retrieved 2025-12-17; "Wendy Dunlap County Clerk ... Kim Bowers County Treasurer"](https://woodward.okcounties.org/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with deference to her family legacy; involve her family or heirs in discussions to address any long-term land concerns.

neighbors.name: Luttrell, Katie J. & David
neighbors.claims: Katie J. and David Luttrell jointly own land in the rural Mutual area of Woodward County [Data USA — other, retrieved 2025-12-17; "Mutual, OK had a population of 16 people with a median age of 40.8"](https://datausa.io/profile/geo/mutual-ok). They have not been identified in any public proceedings or local leadership positions to date [Woodward County Gov. — gov, retrieved 2025-12-17; "Wendy Dunlap County Clerk ... Kim Bowers County Treasurer"](https://woodward.okcounties.org/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the couple in a friendly, neighbor-to-neighbor conversation to share project information and invite their questions or input.
N/A – see organizational profile for engagement strategy.
N/A – see organizational profile for engagement strategy.

neighbors.name: Sander, Tracy D.
neighbors.claims: Tracy D. Sander appears to be part of a prominent ranching family; relatives Wesley Sander and Cody G. Sander are among Woodward County’s top farm subsidy recipients ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=40153&progcode=total&regionname=WoodwardCounty%2COklahoma#:~:text=4%20%20,%241%2C410%2C256)). No evidence was found of Tracy Sander holding any civic office or speaking publicly on development issues ([www.cityofwoodward-ok.gov](https://www.cityofwoodward-ok.gov/151/City-Commissioners#:~:text=ok,the%20boundaries%20of%20the%20current)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a local rancher or Farm Bureau contact her, emphasizing that any project would respect agricultural land use and family legacy.

neighbors.name: Smith, Jim & Eldena
neighbors.claims: Jim and Eldena Smith are listed as landowners in the Mutual area of Woodward County ([www.land.com](https://www.land.com/property/160-acres-in-woodward-county-oklahoma/23465173/#:~:text=...for%20Sale%20,Auction%20%26%20Realty%2C%20Inc)). They have no public record of community leadership or stated views on development, suggesting they maintain a very low profile ([www.cityofwoodward-ok.gov](https://www.cityofwoodward-ok.gov/151/City-Commissioners#:~:text=Commissioners%201.%20,the%20boundaries%20of%20the%20current)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Smiths through a familiar local figure (neighbor or county extension agent) in an informal setting, addressing any concerns about privacy and property rights.

neighbors.name: Cole, James R. & Katheryn J.
neighbors.claims: James R. Cole (Mutual, OK) received about $147,000 in farm program payments from 1995 to 2024 ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=1&z=1&zip=73853#:~:text=49%20%20,%24%20138%2C437.68)), indicating active farming operations. Neither James nor Katheryn Cole has been mentioned in local news or meeting minutes, reflecting an absence of public civic activity ([www.cityofwoodward-ok.gov](https://www.cityofwoodward-ok.gov/151/City-Commissioners#:~:text=ok,the%20boundaries%20of%20the%20current)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Coles via a peer in the farming community and discuss how the development could provide benefits or supplemental income to local farmers.

neighbors.name: Mark Paul Lamm & Nancy Dianne Lamm
neighbors.claims: Mark P. Lamm and Nancy D. Lamm own property in Mutual, a small town in Woodward County, Oklahoma (population 63 in 2020) [Wikipedia — other, retrieved 2025-12-17; "Population Total: 63"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutual,_Oklahoma). The Mutual area has historically seen only modest growth and limited public activity [Wikipedia — other, retrieved 2025-12-17; "saw only minimal growth"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutual,_Oklahoma).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with a friendly, personal visit (ideally involving a neighbor they know) to build trust and ensure their questions about land use or any disturbances are fully addressed.

neighbors.name: Charles Newton Brown
neighbors.claims: Charles N. Brown is a landowner in the Mutual area of Woodward County, a rural community with only a few dozen residents [Wikipedia — other, retrieved 2025-12-17; "population was 61 at the 2010 census"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutual,_Oklahoma).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a one-on-one conversation (possibly arranged through a mutual acquaintance) to explain the project and listen to any concerns he may have, emphasizing open communication.

neighbors.name: Pittman Ranch LLC
neighbors.claims: Pittman Ranch LLC is an Oklahoma limited liability company holding ranch land near Mutual in Woodward County ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). The LLC has no listed business operations or online presence beyond property ownership records, indicating it is a private family ranch entity ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). A review of county filings shows no recorded transactions involving Pittman Ranch LLC and the solar developer (Mutual Solar, LLC) as of 2025 ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). No UCC liens or litigation records were found under the company’s name in public databases, suggesting minimal external financial activity ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private ranch with limited public profile or political activity

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the family owners directly to address any ranching impact concerns; offer leasing terms that provide supplemental income while assuring minimal disturbance

neighbors.name: Downs Medical Properties, LLC
neighbors.claims: Downs Medical Properties, LLC holds two parcels in Woodward County and appears to be a real estate investment entity ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). The company’s name suggests ownership of medical or commercial properties, but no active business presence is noted locally in Woodward (no clinics or offices under this name) ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). No state business filings or liens were found beyond the deed records, implying it functions as a passive landholding vehicle ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). The beneficial owners are not disclosed in public records, and the LLC has not been identified in any recorded agreements related to the proposed solar project ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-town investment with no local operations or community role

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the registered agent or owner with a clear financial offer for land use; emphasize ease of transaction and ROI to encourage cooperation

overview_summary: None of the three individual landowners have publicly stated positions on the development, leaving their stances unknown. All identified neighbors are private landholders without official roles, indicating generally low influence in the community. No high-influence neighbors were noted in this profile. All three profiled neighbors have no documented stance on development or clean energy projects. None holds a high-profile community position, and each appears to wield low public influence in local affairs. All three nearby landowners show no clear public stance on development or clean energy, with no records of open support or opposition. None hold any known public office or leadership roles, indicating mainly low influence in the small Mutual community, and no high-influence neighbors are identified. The adjacent landowners consist of family trusts and locally-registered LLCs. Several are legacy ranching interests held in revocable trusts (e.g., Lawson Fenton and Lanny Sander), while others are small private companies like Pittman Ranch LLC (agricultural) and Downs Medical Properties LLC (investment in land). One trust (Fenton) has already transacted with the solar developer, signaling support ([webserver2.okcountyrecords.com](https://webserver2.okcountyrecords.com/detail/woodward/2024-003846/34077156#:~:text=,Search%20MUTUAL%20SOLAR%2C%20LLC)). Overall, these neighbors are primarily long-time landholders, not commercial developers, so their influence stems from acreage and local ties rather than corporate or political clout. Key considerations include the Fenton trust’s cooperation (a possible ally) and the unknown stance of the remaining owners, who could either seek financial incentives or resist changes to their land use.
